result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeris L Hoppe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
